audienceId.description:
The unique identifier for the audience.
Use the [audiences](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/audiences/#/Discovery/listAudiences) discovery resource to look up audience identifiers.

groupId.description:
The string identifying a group of audiences. Only numbers formatted as strings are accepted (e.g., "1").
To add audiences to a new group, choose any string not currently being used on this forecast.

reach.description: The reach number of the selected data point of the reach forecast.

reachForecastId.description: The identifier of the Reach Forecast that the specified budget is allocated to.

ContentGenreV1.description:
Include/Exclude content based on genre.
Content with GENRE_NOT_AVAILABLE includes content where genre is unavailable or unknown.

CountryCodeV1.description: The code of the country for the forecast.

deduplicatedReachForecasts.description:
A list of Deduplicate Reach Forecasts to create.
Maximum 100 unique Reach Forecasts can be involved in a single request.

budgetAllocations.description:
The list of budget allocations for the Reach Forecasts to have their reach deduplicated.
Total number of unique Reach Forecast IDs in budgetAllocations in the same request
must be less than 100.

deduplicatedReachForecastId.description: This is the unique identifier of the Deduplicated Reach Forecast resource.

index.description: This is the index of the corresponding request element in the request paylod.
This is the index of the corresponding request element in the request paylod.

commonTargets.description:
The list of common targets to be applied to all reach forecasts to be created in this request.
The common targets will be added into each forecast specific targets to obtain the final targeting.

reachForecasts.description: A list of reach forecast to be created.

advertisedProductCategoryIds.description:
The identifiers of the advertised product categories for the forecast.
Use the DSP [ListAdvertisedProductCategories API](https://advertising.amazon.

endDate.description: The forecast end date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

startDate.description: The forecast start date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

targets.description:
The list of targets for the forecast.
Targets of the same targetType and of the same negative boolean are combined using OR statements.
Targets of different types are associated using AND statements.

availableImpressions.description:
The number of impressions available for you to purchase after considering contention
(G - booked demand) among the matchingImpressions

avgCpm.description: The CPM rate (cost per thousand impressions).

creationDateTime.description: The date time that the reach forecast was created.

dataPoints.description: The list of data points for the reach curve.

matchingImpressions.description: The number of impressions that match your targeting

maxCpm.description: The maximum CPM rate (cost per thousand impressions).

reachForecastId.description: This is the unique identifier of the Reach Forecast resource.

index.description: This is the index of the corresponding request element in the request paylod.
This is the index of the corresponding request element in the request paylod.

CurrencyCodeV1.description: The currency for an associated monetary value.

DeliveryTypeV1.description: The delivery method of the envisioned campaign.

DeviceTypeV1.description: The type of device being targeted.

DspContentRatingV1.description:
Exclude content based on available content rating options:
<li> SUITABLE_FOR_ALL_AUDIENCES: Equivalent to content that is rated G (film), TV-Y (TV), TV-Y7 (TV), TV-G (TV), EC (game), or E (game).

FrequencyCapTypeV1.description: The type of advertising frequency cap. If UNCAPPED, no other fields are used.

FrequencyCapV1.description: The limit of how many times ads appear to the same viewer.

maxImpressions.description: The maximum number of times an ad is displayed.

iabContentCategory.description:
The IAB content category to target.
To get the list of valid values, see https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/dsp-campaigns/#tag/Discovery/operation/getIabContentCategories

inventorySourceId.description:
The identifier of the inventory source.
These can be obtained from the inventory sources discovery endpoint.

InventorySourceTypeV1.description:
The type of inventory source to be targeted.
<li>DEAL: Deal inventory.

maxResults.description: Number of records to include in the paginated response.

nextToken.description: Token value for navigating to the next response page.

reachForecastId.description: This is the unique identifier of the Reach Forecast resource.

nextToken.description: Token value for navigating to the next response page.

maxResults.description: Number of records to include in the paginated response.

nextToken.description: Token value for navigating to the next response page.

reachForecastIds.description: The IDs of Reach Forecasts to be retrived.

items.description: This is the unique identifier of the Reach Forecast resource.

nextToken.description: Token value for navigating to the next response page.

advertisedProductCategoryIds.description:
The identifiers of the advertised product categories for the forecast.
Use the DSP [ListAdvertisedProductCategories API](https://advertising.amazon.

availableImpressions.description:
The number of impressions available for you to purchase after considering contention
(G - booked demand) among the matchingImpressions

avgCpm.description: The CPM rate (cost per thousand impressions).

creationDateTime.description: The date time that the reach forecast was created.

dataPoints.description: The list of data points for the reach curve.

endDate.description: The forecast end date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

matchingImpressions.description: The number of impressions that match your targeting

maxCpm.description: The maximum CPM rate (cost per thousand impressions).

reachForecastId.description: This is the unique identifier of the Reach Forecast resource.

startDate.description: The forecast start date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

geoLocation.description:
The location to target.
Use the [GeoLocation API](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/dsp-campaigns#tag/Discovery/operation/getGeoLocations) to obtain targetable location IDs.

negative.description: Whether to target (false) or exclude (true) the given target.

spend.description: The forecasted spend in requested currency based on the estimated average CPM.

ReachForecastStatusV1.description:
The status of the reach forecast.
SUCCESS: The forecast is run successful.
EXPIRED: The forecast data is no longer up-to-date. In order to access the forecast you will need to submit a new request.

ReachTypeV1.description: The unit of reach represented in the data.

post.description:
Creates a list of De-duplicated Reach Forecasts.

DSP Rodeo Entity ID, DSP Advertiser Account ID

**Parameter name**:
Amazon-Ads-AccountId

header

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["campaign_edit"]
